result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T Giuffre

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Defendant Michael T Giuffre not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Michael T Giuffre.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the defendant needs to get anger management counseling in which they are backed up; he doesn't start until October 26th.  Atty Johnson requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:29 PM Defendant Michael T Giuffre not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Michael T Giuffre.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson is completing domestic abuse counseling which should be sometime in November; requests another status.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:53 PM Defendant Michael T Giuffre not in court.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Michael T Giuffre.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Johnson states that the matter is not yet resolved; the defendant needs to complete Domestic Violence Counseling.  

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

09:01 AM Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by phone means for Defendant Michael T Giuffre. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Johnson requests matter be set for further status and believes this is heading toward resolution.  No objection by Atty Burdon.
BY THE COURT:  Set for status.
  Status hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on March 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000728,
Payable Number: 74060,
Receipt Number: 22R 001190,
Amount: $20.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:45 PM Defendant Michael T Giuffre appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews file.  Atty Burdon notes an offer was extended when defendant was incarcerated.  Defendant states he accepted the offer.  Atty Burdon notes it would be a criminal conviction.  Court informs defendant he has some forms that need to be completed before a plea can be entered.  Atty Burdon states offer for the record.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for in person plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status hearing on March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
*No contact with Victim 1 or his residence  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  
  Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

02:30 PM Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael T Giuffre appeared by video means.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and states that he received an offer.  
Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver of attorney made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
Defendant understands who victim 1 is.  Defendant questions the no contact with the residence.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Victim 1 or his residence
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.  Status hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
